Name: Rab3A
Knockout: Viable and fertile; perinatal lethality of Rab3A/B/C/D quadruple KO mice; 30% reduction of Ca2+-triggered synaptic release [[140-142]]

Name: Rab4B
Knockout: Adipocyte hypertrophy and insulin resistance in T cell-specific KO mice [[143]]

Name: Rab6A
Knockout: Embryonic lethal; defects in basement membrane formation in KO embryos [[144, 145]]

Name: Rab7A (7)
Knockout: Embryonic lethal; defects in microautophagy in the visceral endoderm of KO embryos [[147]]

Name: Rab8A
Knockout: Die at postnatal week 4, defects in apical protein localization, and microvillus inclusion bodies [[130, 148, 149]]

Name: Rab8B
Knockout: No obvious phenotype; Rab8A/B double KO mice die at postnatal week 3 [[130]]

Name: Rab13
Knockout: Viable; reduced lymphocyte numbers and reduced lymophocyte trafficking [[121]]

Name: Rab18
Knockout: Viable and fertile; ocular and neurological abnormalities [[155]]

Name: Rab20
Knockout: Decreased formation of Mycobacterium tuberculosis-containing proteolytic phagosomes [[119]]

Name: Rab27B
Knockout: Secretory defects in various endocrine, exocrine, and immune cells [[167-169]]

Name: Rab32
Knockout: Increased susceptibility to Salmonella Typhi [[117]]; coat and eye pigment dilution, some enlarged lung multilamellar bodies, and prolonged bleeding in Rab32/38 DKO mice [[114]]

Name: Rab34
Knockout: Preweaning lethality; polydactyly; cleft-lip/palate; ciliogenesis defect [[124, 125]]

Name: Rab38
Knockout: Hypopigmentation; prolonged bleeding; pulmonary fibrosis [[179]]; coat and eye pigment dilution, some enlarged lung multilamellar bodies, and prolonged bleeding in Rab32/38 DKO mice [[114]]

Name: Rab39A
Knockout: Viable; reduced cross-presentation by dendritic cells [[122]]

Name: Rab43 (41)
Disease: Association with a hereditary liver–colon cancer syndrome [[182]]
Knockout: Viable and fertile; reduced cross-presentation by dendritic cells [[183]]
